channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: "Light It Up for Mito"
item.description:
Sunday, September 22, 2024

City Hall will be lit Green to support "Light It Up for Mito".

World Mitochondrial Disease Week runs from 16 to 22 September 2024. The Lighting international landmarks helps to raise awareness for mitochondrial disease (mito), a little-known but devastating genetic disease with no cure.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Mitochondrial Disease Foundation Limited

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
City Hall will be lit Green to support "Light It Up for Mito".

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Mitochondrial Disease Foundation Limited
item.x-trumba:customfield: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Blood Cancer Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, September 23, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Blood Cancer Awareness Week.

Blood Cancer Awareness Month runs for the month of September, we need to bring this to a wider audience, so people know how simple it is to become a donor, and also raise much needed funding. The Australian Bone Marrow Donor Registry and  Strengthtogive Organisation aim to promote awareness, educate and encourage people to join the stemcell register here in Australia, and ultimately to help save the lives of blood cancer patients.

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Bone Marrow Donor Registry

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.description:

item.title: Dementia Awareness
item.description:
Tuesday, September 24, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Teal to support Dementia Awareness.

Dementia Australia is the national peak body supporting people living with dementia, their families and carers.

During Dementia Action Week in September, we’re encouraging everyone to take the first step to learn more about dementia and how you can help shape our communities for the better

This Light Up is organised by: Dementia Australia

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:

item.title: Pulmonary Fibrosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, September 25, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures  will be lit Blue to support Pulmonary Fibrosis Awareness Month.

Lung Foundation Australia funds life-changing research and delivers support services that give hope to people living with lung disease or lung cancer. We work to ensure lung health is a priority for all, from promoting lung health and early diagnosis, advocating for policy change and research investment, raising awareness about the symptoms and prevalence of lung disease and championing equitable access to treatment and care.

This Light Up is organised by: Lung Foundation Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures  will be lit Blue to support Pulmonary Fibrosis Awareness Month.

City Hall will be lit Orange for the 45th ICMM World Congress on Military Medicine.

Event taking place in City Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day candlelight Vigil
item.description:
Thursday, September 26, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support National Police Remembrance Day candlelight Vigil.

With honour, they served. The sacrifice made by officers who have lost their lives in service to our community is never forgotten. The annual candlelight vigil is a traditional commemoration that takes place throughout Queensland, held prior to National Police Remembrance Day.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2024 ITP Awareness Week
item.description:
Friday, September 27, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support 2024 ITP Awareness Week.

ITP Australia was founded 5 years ago by our CEO Danielle Boyle, to help provide people living with this rare condition with up-to-date Australian information, support, and advocacy on their behalf. Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP) is a rare autoimmune disease where the body’s immune system attacks platelets. Platelets assist the blood to clot and patients with ITP have a low platelet count. Patients with ITP can suffer from a vast range of symptoms and there is no cure.

This Light Up is organised by: ITP Australia Ltd

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: National Police Remembrance Day
item.description:
Sunday, September 29, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Police Remembrance Day.

National Police Remembrance Day (NPRD) recognises annually the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers who have died whilst on duty. It falls on the 29th of September each year. Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honor those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Police Remembrance Day.

Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honor those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.
This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support National Police Remembrance Day.

National Police Remembrance Day (NPRD) recognises annually the dedication to duty and courage displayed by police officers who have died whilst on duty. It falls on the 29th of September each year. Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honour those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Vigils, marches and services are held in the Australasian and South West Pacific regions in honour. The event aims to draw the policing community together to participate to honour those officers who have paid the ultimate sacrifice.
This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Police Service

item.title: Australian Women in Music Awards
item.description:
Monday, September 30, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Australian Women in Music Awards.

The Australian Women in Music Awards highlights the achievements of women in the Australian music industry, and their contribution to the nighttime economy.

This Light Up is organised by: Cicada International

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
